What preparation is needed for this Chec: Fasting is required for about 10 - 12 hours before the sample collection. Consumption of water is permitted.
Who should book this checkup?: The incidence of infectious and non-infectious diseases of the stomach and digestive system is increasing among young Indians. Unhygienic food and water lead to infectious diseases such as food poisoning and diarrhea. While lifestyle practices, including irregular mealtime, less water intake, lack of exercise, eating junk food and alcohol abuse, contribute to increasing chronic digestive problems. This health checkup helps in early detection of serious problems of the stomach and digestive system, including liver and kidney dysfunction, celiac disease and pancreatitis.Includes 50 TestAdvanced Renal Profile6 testsUrea Nitrogen BloodCalcium Ion Specific Electrode Potentiometric Method BloodChloride BloodCreatinine Conventional BloodSodium BloodBun / Serum Creatinine Ratio Calculated Blood SerumHemogram -
